channel.title: A Thing Like Imageshack
channel.description:
hey everyone i know this is proboly difficult but im looking for a code or w/e for myself to host images on my own website without having to go in my filemanager and stuff to do it
so bassicly the same thing as imageshack.us except no resizing no emails stuff all i want it to do is when u browse for your image then you clikc upload it uploads to a certain folder on my website and then gives me a direct link
how can i do this?

item.title: A Thing Like Imageshack
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

hmm well, im stupid when it comes to stuff like that, ok i created a folder called upload, then a file called index.php then i put

File..

in it then i made a file called upload.php and put

<?php if (is_uploaded_file($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'])) { copy($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'], './' ); //copy to location echo 'Bestand: ' . $_FILES['image']['name'] . ' success'; //print } else //error { echo 'Error'; } ?>

in it then i tried to upload an image and it borught me to http://www.everything-known.net/upload/file2.php with a 404 to then i made a file called file2.php with this code

<?php if (is_uploaded_file($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'])) { copy($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'], './' ); //copy to location echo 'Bestand: ' . $_FILES['image']['name'] . ' success'; //print } else //error { echo 'Error'; } ?>

and i tried ti upload an image and it said this

Bestand: study.gif success what do i do

PS: i checked the directory to see if the image was even uploaded, it wasent

Read full topic

item.title: A Thing Like Imageshack
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Make a directory called /upload/

index.php

File..

upload.php

<?php if (is_uploaded_file($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'])) { copy($_FILES['image']['tmp_name'], './' ); //copy to location echo 'Bestand: ' . $_FILES['image']['name'] . ' success'; //print } else //error { echo 'Error'; } ?>

Excuse me if this doesn’t work properly, i wrote this by hand.

Read full topic
